text: Flaske 750ml fra Vinmonopolet Tromsdalen. Gyldengul. Uklar. Høyt tett skum som daler raskt. Lett sitrusaroma. Smaken banan & gjær. Syrlig.
750 ml bottle from Belgoklubben. Hazy light yellow with white head. Fruity, spicy yeast with citrus and herbs. Semi sweet with low bitterness and medium carbonation.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2017 Oklar orangegul med tunt vitt skum. Doftar syrligt, fruktigt, lite ananas, citrus och mango. Smaken medelfyllig, syrlig med lite kryddor, vitpeppar och koriander. Eftersmaken hyggligt lång, lite citrus och kryddor. Mkt kolsyra.

(draught) hazy golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of powdered sugar and wheat, with some notes of lemon peel, candle wax and black pepper. flavour is mostly the same, lots of wheat and powdered sugar, with a touch of herbal hops, some gooseberries and a medium-bitter finish. medium- to heavy-bodied with average carbonation.

Colore giallo leggermente torbido, schiuma abbondante e persistente, carbonazione importante ma delicata. Al naso frumento, limone. Sapore di frumento, avena, coriandolo. Una Blanche molto delicata dove tutti i sapori non sono invadenti, che puó piacere anche ai non amanti del genere.
Buonissima blanche, dai chiari sentori agrumati e speziati, soprattutto coriandolo. Molto saporita e rinfrescante, malgrado il suo grado alcolico. Molto equilibrata, non stanca mai.
Draft at Meddlesome Moth, Dallas. Pours hazy gold with a small white head. Aroma id wheat, a touch of citrus, spice. Taste is wheat, fruit, yeast, Belgian spice, white pepper.

Appearance: translucent dirty pale gold with two fingers of fizzy white head diminishing rapidly to a persistent thick creamy cap, patchy lacing. (3/5) Aroma: doughy yeast, orange peel, banana, coriander/clove, hint of floral. (7/10) Taste: moderate sweet, mild bitter. (7/10) Palate: Medium-light slightly slick body, lively to moderate carbonation, off-dry mildly bitter and spicy warming finish. (4/5)

Im pretty sure this is the first time Ive ever had a double white, and its not your typical Belgian, thats for sure. Initially, the aroma is dominated by a bready, doughy yeast completely unlike anything Ive encountered in a Belgian before. (Though quite similar to e.g. Council Brewings house yeast, which Im sure is 100% Saccharomyces cerevisiae, or bakers yeast.) That doughy aroma settles back along with the initially large and fizzy white head, allowing the more traditional Witbier aromas to come through. The higher alcohol seems to come through in the middle and finish, presenting as - well, its not fair to say solvent-like, since that implies a harshness thats not present - but certainly a sweet slick warmth not present in a typical Witbier. For the second glass, I swirled in the lees, and both the curaçao orange peel and coriander spiciness amped up considerably. Not without its charms, but fairly middle of the pack both for Witbiers and for Belgian beers in general. (14/20)
Aroma floral, meloso, fruta verde. En boca es fresca y de final seco largo con sabor de fruta verde y flores.

Fra flaske (flasket 26.11.16) på Mi2 Cardinal feb-17: lett uklar korngul med flott skum som varer. Iflg papiromslaget er ingrediensene "water barley malt, wheat malt, hoops, yeast, sugar, coriander, curacaopeels". I tillegg til dette finner jeg et snev av banan. Frisk, spennende og velsmakende.
Shared bottle at Mi2 at Cardinal 13.02.17. Cloudy and pale yellow. White head. Aroma of fresh grass and sorrel. Taste of sorrel, lemon and green bananas. Lively carbonation.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2017 Shared bottle at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours cloudy golden with dense white head. Aroma of bananas, coriander, oranges, light bread. Tastes slightly bitter with some sweetness. Thin bodied, fruity finish.
Sample yellow golden beer small head. Aroma is banana citrus, malt, taste is the same, quite fizzy. Ok

750 ml bottle, Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 7.0%. Very pale straw colour, large white head. Strong aroma of banana, coriander, cloves and curacao orange peel, some alcohol. Slightly sweet but still refreshing wheaty flavour, citrus, banana and spices.
Tåkete gulbrun med fingerhøyt hvitt skum. Lukter halm, honning, banan og urter. Middels fylde. Syrlig, lett bitterhet og lett sødme. Sitrusskall, korn og banan. Middels lang.
Gul uklar farge med masse luftig skum. Lukter korn, banan og litt sitrus. Smaker friskt og smak av banan. Lettdrikkelig.

Draft sample at Luppolo Station Roma, Italy. Pour it clear golden color with small white head. Aroma Belgian yeasty typical, some coriander, orange peel maybe. Taste lots of wheat, breas, cereal and toast on the back, floral just a little bit, citrus at the end, some clove in the middle, all together good balanced, medium sweetness, medium body, slick feel, fizzy, dry finish.

0.75 bottle
Clear pale, cream head with good retention. Light zesty, mandarin and blonde orange peel, light spices (coriander, cloves, ginger), biscuit, cream, raisins and rum. 
Cream, spicy (cloves, ginger, coriander), honey, candy orange, butterscotch,
Pours a hazy golden body with a medium head. Fresh yeasty aroma. Taste is creamy, sweet and well balanced.

On tap at Feria Noblejas. Hazy golden with with big whiteish head. Aroma of lemon, herby coriander, citrus, flowers, sweet malts and banana. Taste has herby coriander, sweet malt, wheat, citrus, banana and slight yeast.

Witty Witman is in the house und öffnet seinen Sack mit deliziösen Kräutern. Mit seinem schlanken Mundgefühl betört es fast und aufgrund seiner üppigen Prozente erinnert es, gerade beim Abspann, ein wenig an ein Tripel. Toll. ZYTHOS BEER FESTIVAL 2016 in Leuven. 0,1/1 Jetson vom Hahn.

On Tap @5ª Feria de la Cerveza de Noblejas. 01/10/16
Color amarillo aromas tirgo levadura, sabor levadura, citrico

Superbe robe dorée, trouble, fine mousse peu persistante. Nez complexe sur des notes fruitées, des céréales, notes lactiques, agrumes. Bouche à lattaque acidulée, un très beau fruit, de la puissance, une fine amertume et une longue finale puissante et équilibrée. De loin la meilleure blanche belge. Un régal.

Caña en el señor Lupulo Gijón. 22..09..2016 (r351). Color amarillento turbio con espuma blanca Aromas y sabores algo intensos frescos herbaceos con toques abundantes de limon y citricos. Cuerpo medio a intenso algo pastoso. Se salva por los 7 vol que lleva. No está mal.

Where: The Partisan, Washington DC. 
How: 750ml, paper-wrapped bottle.
Appearance: Poured into a glass it looks like the traditional wit  pale, hazy yellow with a creamy white head. 
Aroma: Moderate to moderately low aromas of citrus, orange, cardamom and wheat and a hint of grapefruit. 
Taste: A flavorful palate of spicy malt, citrus, orange peel and spice finishes dry. The malt and spice mask the alcohol quite well. 
Palate: Medium to medium light body.
Overall: This might be better described as a double wit with the beers fuller body and higher alcohol from most wits. It is very drinkable and refreshing.

Tap
@ Irreale, Madrid, Spain.
A: Hazy golden.
T: Malt, citrusy, fruity, slightly yeasty.

4 oz pour on draft at B Side, served in a wine glass. Hazy yellow with off-white head. Aromas of lemon citrus, floral notes, light banana. Tastes of herbs, light spice, coriander, citrus, light banana. Medium-light body with a dry finish.
Cloudy pale golden color, white head with good lasting. Aroma is citrusy with light maltiness. Fruity favor with light bitterness. Some sourness in the final with dry mouthfeel.

Many thanks for this beer to Eric De Geyter from Belgiums Best. Papier nie sciagniety podczas nalewania, tak jak podano w informnacji, perfekcyjnie schłodzone. Piwo podwojne, mocno metniste o szarym zabarwieniu i ciemno pomarańczowej barwie, piana srednia biala szybko opada. Troche alkoholowe, fakt ale estry i aromaty super, oliwki zielone w zapachu, curacao, olejek kokosowy w smaku, pomarancze, biale porzeczki oraz sporo skorki od pszennego białego chleba. Ciekawe i zupelbie inny witbir. Polecam

Utseende: Gul.

small sample, poured a pale yellow to light golden colour with a white head. nose of wheat, citrus, lemon zest, orange, pale malts, some cloves and banana, taste lead to some spices, and a dry yeast finish. nice dry mouthfeel

Pale golden, quite pale, massive frothy white head. Smell of yeast esters, orange peel, spices, herbs, light malts. Moderate sweet, alot of spices like cardemomme, clove and cinnamon. Orange peel, fruity esters, quite tasty. Moderate bitter finish. All in all a very good beer, but for the style wit i think its too heavy. Not as refreshing as i would like it to be

Quelle fantastique idée quune « double blanche », cest-à-dire une strong wit, ou encore une imperial white  Niveau abv à 7 % pour mon exemplaire. Je ne sais pas si elle est allée jusquà 
7,5 comme indiqué sur ratebeer, mais cest un magnifique niveau pour une blanche.
Malts dorge et de blé, plusieurs houblons, coriandre, écorce dorange curaçao.
Mon exemplaire avait 10 mois de bouteille en format 75 cl.
Couleur doré clair, à la clarté pure (contrairement au sempiternel voile des blanches, qui commence
à devenir un faux semblant ).
Bulles fines, partout, par milliers, très vives. Superbe.
Mousse blanche bien crémeuse, stable à 8 mm.
Arômes de blé, angélique, pointe de genièvre, girofle, coriandre.
1ère bouche douce à soyeuse, à la magnifique prise sur le blé, la coriandre, des épices fines.
Arrière-bouche avec zeste dorange, longue, précise.
2ème au superbe enchaînement avec une fine pointe de guignolet.
Arrière-bouche très riche, complexe.
3ème au splendide ensemble délicat, finement fruité.
Arrière-bouche fine, délicate, parfumée.
Longueur qui travaille tout le registre de la délicatesse, avec un grand talent, et la volonté de 
détailler les impressions ultimes. Du très beau blé aussi.
Jambes fines, serrées, groupées.
Levure douce, fine, très grande ligne.
Alcool parfait, il démontre que les blanches peuvent parfaitement saccommoder dun haut niveau
abv, qui leur donne une saveur pleine et complète. Évidemment ce nest pas pour les femmelettes
qui sirotent lété en terrasse ...
Finale grandiose, très inspirée. Je la vois comme un certain tableau de Bruegel ...
CONCLUSION : quelle démonstration de savoir-faire .. Quelle idée superbe dune double blanche.
Mais il faut pour cela avoir affaire à un brasseur sachant brasser . cest le cas manifeste ici.
Pour toutes ces raisons et cette audace brassicole, nous accordons avec grand plaisir notre premier
5 à une blanche . il a fallu quand même en boire 27 pour y arriver !!!!

DWF; Bottle 75 cl., from Vinmonopolet. Pours unclear golden with a boble white, moderate lasting and lacing head. Nose is moderate yeast, wheat, light citrus, coriander and pepperish spice. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a lasting spice finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.
0.75 flask DWF . Gul halv klar med litt hvit skum. Aroma gjær pepper koriander. Smak sitrus koriander. Middels co2

Great wit. Profile and crisp, full bodied and spiced well with a heavy lemon zest and full toasted wheat malts. A bit sweet and a nicely done zesty lemon and pepper ester base. Best tasting and smelling wit Ive had in a while.
Hazy pale yellow with fluffy carbonating head. Banana, lemon, coriander, Belgian wit-esters and light melon. Sweet, slick and spicy, rye bread and noble hop finish. Overall: Nice.

Bottle at Eulogy. Very hazy greenish yellow gold with a large foamy top. No lace. Bigger than usual witt/white beer but only modestly interesting. Green banana peels. Unexpected somewhat creamy mouthfeel. Big carbonation. Bramble. Honeycomb. Thistle. Lemon/lime citrus edge. Worth a try but not worth a long stay. A nicely full wheat beer but not extraordinary.

750 ml bottle. Slightly unclear golden body with a huge, fluffy white head. Pleasant mild fruity aroma with spices and oranges. Flavor has sweet pale malt, some wheat, spices and refreshing fruit. Fine balanced body and good aftertaste in the same direction. Lovely version of a wit.
Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of fruitiness, spice, some yeast and oranges. Flavor is sweet and fruity with some yeast, spices and citrus. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle 75cl, a cloudy orange beer with good head. Nose is orange, lemon and wheat. Aroma is medium sweet, belgian yeast, lemon, orange notes, touch of quince, phenols, apple skin, astringency, very classic wit, why is this one such expensive ?

750 ml bottle. Pours a very finely veiled orangeish whitish straw with a resilient white head. Aroma is orange, coriander, mint and pepper. Flavor is coriander, pepper, mint, vanilla, orange, oldish. Finish is slightly herbal, but mostly spicy. Lingering orange and vanilla. Medium to full body, soft mouthfeel and average carbonation.

750ml bottle. Hazy light amber shade. Big white head at first. Aroma has plenty of lemon, floral and bubblegum notes. Hints of all kinds of fruits in the taste. Gets near to pineapple even. Strong carb helps it along. Very clean and crisp. Great drinkability. Very nice wit.

0.75l bottle. Hazy golden body, enormous white head. Aroma of bread, coriander, spearmint, orange zest and citruses. Taste of orange peel, citruses, coriander and maybe even a hint of pine. Medium body, creamy texture. Very lively taste and aroma. Awesome.

Sweet citrus, spices, spearmint all from a huge fluffy head. Perfect wit appearance with a hazy yellow brew topped off with tons of head. Big carbonation. Flavor is more subtle than aroma, but the coriander is present, light silky malts. A wonderful example of the style. Satisfying, but makes you come back for more everytime! Thanks for sharing @kapusil.

Hazy yellow color. Bubbles almost jumped out of the glass. Pleasant, complex fruit yeast aroma. Touches of grapefruit and cookies. Balanced sweetness to the sound wheat taste. Almost no hop bitterness. Tastes of oranges and light caramel. A very tasty brew.

Bue en bouteille de 75cl. Superbe nez sur la fleur blanche, l'herbe et le houblon. Palais fruits jaunes, fleurs, houblon. Parfaitement équilibrée. Finale longue pleine d'arôme. Belle complexité pour une blanche.

Bue en bouteille de 75cl à la maison,
couleur blanche/blonde, mousse et effervescence moyenne,
nez sur le brett et la levure de blanche un peu banane.
Une attaque sur le début sur la banane et le fruit jaune avec une pointe citronnée du brett

Bottle. Cloudy golden body with white head. Aroma is malts yeast some caramel with oranges and spices and hints of almonds and citrus. Taste is malts funk some spices and oranges and ripe fruits. Aftertaste is malty with some fruits and dryness and low bitterness. Nice one.

750ml bottle from Vinmonopolet. The beer Ive rated is the 7.0% ABV one. Cloudy pale orange/yellow body. Enormous frothy white head. Aroma is orange, funk and spices. Yeasty! Mostly sweet on the tongue. Smooth and nice!

(Bottle) Pale golden colour with big, but brief, white head. Fruity nose with notes of lemon peel, white bread, coriander, apple sauce and peaches. Fruity, wheaty taste with lemon peel, white bread, coriander, custard, ripe pears, peaches and a touch of grass in the finish. More than medium body, with a touch of sweetness. Tasty and well made witbier with lots of character. Nice one.
At Villagio Della Birra 2015.Listed at 7%.Hazy yellow color, white head. Sweet, light yeasty scent. Sweet, fresh taste. Herbal, sweet aftertaste. Medium to fizzy mouthfeel, low bitterness.

750ml bottle. Light hazy golden orange color with off white head. Aroma is citrusy fruity, banana too, yeasty spicy, coriander, malty grainy. Sweet and bitter taste. Light to medium almost oily body with average carbonation.

Bottle, 75cl. Gusher. An unclear orange-colored beer topped by a small, off-white head. The aroma has some yeast, with oranges, some pale malts and coriander. Rather high on carbonation, full-bodied. and semi-dry, with flavors of oranges, pine cones and a touch of pale malts. Nice carbonation. Citrusy, orange mostly, finish. A decent one, nothing impressive going on. 150807

Bottle 750ml @ yngwie
Gusher.. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, wheat, citrus, orange, yeast and hint of gooseberries and alcohol. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter with a long orange, wheat, citrus and yeasty finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is very fizzy

A light yellow, strong bubbling, a head is big and white. Aroma has wheat, lemon and some oranges, coriander, some yeast and banana. Taste has wheat, lemon, bananas, low spicyness. Medium bodied, strong carbonation. More tastefull and richer witbier with the nice lightness just as it should be. I like this beer.
Die Stärke des Biers ist ein ungewöhnlicher Pluspunkt neben den leichten Grasnoten und dem Heu. Angenehm dazu Stroh, etwas an Gewürzen und ein bisschen Keks. Top.

Bottle from Rudat in Dortmund. The beer has got a hazy golden-strawy colour with a steady head and smooth body. Aroma of flowers, wit and herbs. Taste of hops, wheat, bread, flowers, Belgian yeast, caramel, straw and herbs. Smooth to drink, very tasty.

Bottle form Belgiuminabox.com

Pours clear blonde, under a good white foam. Smell is citrussy, some malty notes as well. Bit to the dry side. Taste is bit bitter, citrussy, white-type spices. very balanced and nicely intense.

Bottle at home. Has a cloudy dark yellow color with extremely much off-white foam. Fresh aroma of lime, Belgian yeast, cloves and hay. More hay in the aroma along with grass, orange peel, hops and some alcohol. Medium body, slick and soft mouth feel, and light bitterness. A fresh and fruity wit.

In bottiglia. Colore giallo paglierino, velata. Schiuma fine, persistente e molto abbondante. Aroma di coriandolo, arancia, frumento, pepato. Al palato corpo rotondo, leggermente troppo gasata, aromi intensi di speziatura e agrume. Lalcool non si sente assolutamente, finale secco di coriandolo.
Molto beverina ed equilibrata con unottima intensità degli aromi

Cloudy, quite pale yellow body with a rather large, white, long-lived head that laces the glass well. Sweet and strong aroma of oranges, lots of oranges, Belgian yeast, and spices. The oranges are also very obvious in the strong flavour. In addition I get spices, Belgian yeast and hints of perfume and soap. Mid-bodied, dry and lively carbonated. Feels a bit sweeter than many wits of lower ABV, vague traces of acidity but hardly any bitterness. A nice one! 
[75 cl bottle shared with Svensenga smak & behag, from Vinmonopolet Online]

On bottle from Vinmonopolet Norway, on order ( bu). Slightly hazy golden color- plenty of foam and high carbonation. Medium/ high aroma intensity; fruity, banana , citrus and nice yeast influence. Medium/ full body & complexity. Some immediate sweetness, well balanced with high bitterness. Very enjoyable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Nose is banana, wheat, bubblegum, slight lemon character, almonds, marzipan. Taste is a little triple like with caramel and honey notes, leading to wheat, marzipan, almonds,spice, corriander, orange notes, lots of banana and bubblegum, peppery in a dry lemony finish.
Mouthfeel is good

A very nice wit, which manages to be sweet in body and quite dry in finish.

Bottled november 2013. Yellow pour with orange hue, soapy foam head. Aroma: there is a difference between the foam aromas, and the aroma from the beer. The latter is: typical Glazen Toren yeast, hint of white wine, faint notes of (exotic) fruit, some dried apricots. The former (foam): citrus / lemon zest, vinegar, quite astringent (hint of chlorine even). Very interesting. Taste resembles white wine. Some fresh grain notes, lemon, but this is definitely more like wine than beer (in taste). Development is quite bitter, sour, with a touch of Saison. Aftertaste is a bit dry, walnuts, hint of white wine.

pours hazy/cloudy pale golden with a nice white head, some retention and lacing. floral astringent herbs, ginger, woodsy, perfume, warming alcohol, sweetish toasted wheat - peppery notes, other cereals - husk traces, spicy clementines, very low-fi phenols - welcoming, spicy honey, spread chalk. average belgian carbonation, light to medium body; drying yet assertive floral-spicy finish. pretty nice off-charts wit.
UPDATED: JUN 15, 2015 Great beer. Bit strong for a white beer but a great aroma and perfect beer for a sunny day
Heldere citroengele kleur met een matige kraag. Ruikt fruitig, zurig, champagne. Smaakt vanille, stro, citrus.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours slightly hazy golden with low white head. Some lacing. Aroma is of spices, coriander. Taste is of perfume, flowers, some bitterness, soap. Palate: Medium body. Soft-medium carbonation. Overall: Good. Just slightly soapy.

Bottle (750 ml). Split 2-ways with JulienHuxley. 

Appearance: Slightly hazy bright golden with a medium fully lasting white head and some lacing.

Aroma: Quite yeasty with banana, moderate spiciness, peppery notes, floral and quite fruity as well.

Taste: Yeasty, banana, moderate spiciness (coriander, peppery notes) and a touch of alcohol, 

Palate: Medium body. Medium carbonation. Moderately dry. Spicy finish. 

Overall: Quite heavy for a Wit but still well balanced and decent drinkability. Interesting.

Bottle. Pale gold pour with light haze, persistent white head. Aroma is fruity, light banana, yeasty, spicy notes. Taste is sweet, banana, estery notes, yeasty, light coriander. Palate is med bodied with med-light carbonation. Decent, fine example of the style.
Bottle. Hazy yellow body with a medium white head. Floral, light yeast, citrus, light alcohol. Nice.

Pours an almost clear golden but there is still a really light haziness (I wouldnt comment on it usually but this is a "double white" after all) and a medium white head that leaves some lacing. Nose is of coriander and some floral and peppery alcohol. Taste is dry and lemony with a light wheat tartness to it. Some oranges as well and some alcohol. Body is light to medium and carbonation medium to high. Overall an interesting concoction that doesnt exactly ring with me in the end. I mean, it is well crafted but I dont see how or when I would drink something like that again. Maybe Im a purist but I believe witbiers should be less than or equal to 5% ABV as saisons should never be more than 8% and that there shouldnt be such a thing as a "triple ESB" and whatnot.
Lightly hazy orange-yellow with good bubbly head. Fine fruity nose with lemon and grapefruit notes. Bitter, toffee, dry finish. Very tasty witbier, recommended.
along with Yves at my home 0.75L bottle white gold blond colored sparkling body with a white head and a spicy citrus hop aroma a spicy fruity hop sweet bitter taste with a bitter finish

Bottle from Systembolaget, bought in April 2012. 

Clear golden with a large white head. Mild aroma of spices, grass, citrus and some yeast. Similar taste. Also some notes of alcohol and something that reminded of marzipan. Still quite refreshing despite the old bottle that I did forgot in the cellar.

Keg at Beergeek. Pours a hazy pale Yellow with a foamy White head. Sourish wheat and orange peel. yeast and a touch of caramel. Has more going on than a typical wit. Quite a pronounced bitterness to finish. Very good.
Shared with wim at wims place. Blond colored beer with small white head and medium carbonation. Herby hopped fruited aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is hopped bitter herby.

Bottle @ Home. Colore giallo ambrato, da velata sino a torbida man mano che ci si avvicina al fondo. Schiuma bianca sporca, fine e persistente. Aroma intenso, fruttato, esteri da lievito belga, pesche, albicocche disidratate, zucchero candito, scorza dagrume, speziatura marcata, cordiandolo in primis. Gusto dolce amabile, non stucchevole. fruttato e zuccherino. Poco o nulla amara, ma leggermente acida, probabilmente per via della presenza del frumento. Mediamente corposa, ha una carbonatazione veramente importante. Calda, anche più dei suoi 7 gradi. Equilibrata ed armonica.

Bottle. Brewtique, Macclesfield. Gusher. Hazy, straw colour. Thin, white head. Wheaty and grainy. Soft toffee, ripe banana thing. A bit buttery and fusty. Some pineapple. Theres a little spice coming through as the beer warms. Taste is soft sweet. Very light dry. Light bitter. Dry, slightly thin palate. Finish is biscuit dry. A touch of sweet. More of the spice. Very drinkable.

At Open Baladin pub in Rome - Italy, draught. Pours hazy yellow, huge white head. Nose: wheat, pepper, hint of banana. Mouth is grainy, lime. Well done!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft at SIB07. Possible first Impy Wit I had? Hints of citrus and grains on the nose. A touch of orange and wheat, a hint of pepper, and lots of dirt and barnyard on the finish.

Another of Jef Van Den Steens experiments in old-fashioned beer styles, this time a tarwedubbel, the strong counterpart of witbier. Sticky, off-white, irregular head, colour of old gold, hazy. Fruity aroma with spicy accents, wheat malt, curaçao, pineapple, cake, coriander, apple peel, peach, vanilla. Soft fruity taste, lightly sweet with fresh citrus touch, relatively sharp carbonation, alcohol well hidden, malty and wheaty base, velvety mouthfeel thanks to the oats, medium hop bitterness in the finish. Very enjoyable and thirst-quenching.
Aroma is straw, banana, clove and sweet graininess. Taste is sweet with a very smooth transition to bitterness. Body is a very pale gold with a very slight cloudiness.

Bottle 0.75l. Pours almost clear golden with very fast vanishing white head. Looks like apple juice after a few seconds. Strange. Aroma is fruity, doughy, spicy, slightly cheesy. Taste is light bitter, medium sweet, spicy, fruity, grainy, coriander. Bit too sweet wit beer with rather strong carbonation. More bitterness would be good, unbalanced though.

Bottle sampled at De Molen 2nd Tuesday Tasting. Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma of citrus, Belgian yeast going towards saison and fruits. Flavour is light moderate sweet and bitter. Strength of the alcohol coming out in the palate suggesting trippel and dry in the finish. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.
Bottle @ 2nd Tuesday tasting. Aroma is spices/herbs, some malt, some wheat, a bit yeasty. Flavour is fruity and floral hops, some malt, not much else. Boring.
Bottle @ 2nd Tuesday tasting at De Molen, hosted by dEnk. Hazy yellow pour. Aroma of fruits, yeasty and with some spices. Flavor is quite bitter, sweet and yeasty. Smooth texture. Nice balance.

Sample at the Molen mnothly tasting.
thin white head. Very hazy blond pour. Quite refreshing. Well hidden alcohol. Belgian yeasty flavour.
Bottle, shared with Parksy and Grippitis. Turbid light orange, brief white head. Orange peel, spices, wheat, subtle funk. Zesty with a creamy mouthfeel. Finish is bone dry. Interesting.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Pallida damigella molto intraprendente, dal carattere poco ortodosso. Gusto complesso e sofisticato, scorza di limone, frutta secca e spezie, tra le quali spicca un leggero pizzicorio di coriandolo. Il 7.5 gradi aleggiando come fantasmi, sorso dopo sorso, agendo di soppiatto. Assaggiata alla spina allo stand di Glazen Toren, è stata unesperienza indimenticabile.

Smell of lemon, yeast. Very pale lemon colour, extreme white head which diminishes quickly. Aroma of coriander, honey, citrus, yeast, mead. Fresh and slightly sour when cold, gets sweeter with temperature.

Paper Wrapped Bottle; Pour is murky gold with a two finger white head into this glass ; retention is on the poor side but this one has a bit more age than youd want on it. The nose is grains, citrus, grass, with mild sweetness and a hint of spices. The flavor profile is grains and citrus initial, with a modest bitterness moving forward ; soft fruits like pear and peach come through but it immediately moves towards the grains, belgian yeast, peppery spicing, and grasses that youd expect. It works well overall, but it doesnt overly impress either

Rating from 2010: My beer had 7%. Witbier-typisches Kräuteraroma. Witbier-trockener Antrunk, zum Hauptteil leicht süßlich-süffig, leichte Kräuter. Vollmundig, mild, aber zu süß. Der Nachgeschmack ist süß-witbierig, koriander, süffig, aber viel zu überlagert-süß.  --> 2% weniger, und dafür  kein  Zucker hätten dem Bier viel besser getan!  --> enttäuschend süß. 7/11/8/7

Hellgelb, opaltrüb, aroma citrus und etwas koriander, würzig im geschnack, stark karbonisiert, gut trinkbar

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 16.06.2013, tap @ Alewife Queens:
Small creamy shortlasting head. Aroma is slightly dry and fruity, light malts, hay, dried fruits, citrus peel, yeast, citrus. Taste is dry, slightly harsh hoppy, light malts, hay, grass, wet grain, cardboard, citrus peel, hops, citrus, yeast. Dry mouthfeel. Not my favorite.
Hazy golden color with white head. Some spicy and yeasty aroma. Light sweet with some spicy flavour.

On tap at Capones. Pours a hazy golden lemon color with a big white head that lasts leaving light rocky lacing. Aroma of cloves, lemon grass, coriander and faint wheat. The taste has a strong orange and lemon zest thats not too bitter, but highly spiced, and a sweet zing that dries off a bit towards the finish. Medium to light body with lively carbonation.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2013 Bottle @beergium.com. Nose is fruity agrum citrus. Nice light golden colour with high carbonation. Quick leaving white head. Mouth is yeasty spicy orange citrus. Very surprising and different white light beer!

Spice, citrus and a little must funk com off the nose. The color is a light cloudy yellow with moderate white head. As far as the flavor there is some light citrusy sweetness but followed by some nice herbal bitterness that finishes dry. The beer is very light and fizzy. This is head and shoulders above most wits on the market but comes across almost like a saison either way a must try beer.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2013 30/V/13 - 75cl bottle from Geers (Oostakker) @ home - BB: n/a - bottled: 29/IX/12 (2013-505) 
Clear dark blond beer, big aery white head, unstable, dissipates quickly, non adhesive. Aroma: bit yeasty, quite some coriander, orange peel, little honey, floral, bit sugary. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: some citrus, pretty floral, lots of orange peel, bit yeasty, sour grains. Aftertaste: little bitter, wheat, some honey, sweet, coriander, quite some orange peel again.

650 ml bottle. Pours a clear yellow gold with light bubbly head and lots of carbonation. Aromas of wheat, earth, apples, and citrus. Flavors of apples and pears, light toasted malts, grain, and light spice. Qutie a bit of carbonation but overall very nice.
Hazy, yellow coloured beer with a small white head. Fresh aroma of wheat. Flavour is wheaty, acidic an yeasty. A nice and well well balanced white beer. (Bottle 75cl)

Bottle. Poured clear yellow color with a medium frothy white head that mostly lasted with fair lacing. Moderate yeast sweet citrus and spice aroma. Medium body with a tingly smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium citrus sweet flavor with a medium sweet finish of moderate duration. My expectations where just met.

Bevuta al Villaggio della Birra 2012 alla spina. Ottimo profilo aromatico complesso e buona base alcolica. Si percepisce una certa speziatura e si sentono le note agrumate/citriche del del curaçao. Deliziosa.

Light pale golden colour, white head. Aroma of malts, hops and spices. Sweet malty aroma, light buckwheat, light hops. Finish malts, light hops and light sweetness.
Nice brew.
(From 75cL bottle @ WW II tasting, Amsterdam. Courtesy of Benzai. Thanks!)
Bottle @ WWT II. Pours hazy yellow with a medium, quickly fading white head. Aroma is sweet malts, some citrus. Taste is wheat, some citrus and spices.

750ml bottle. Hazy pale golden colour with average, frothy, foamy, diminishing, white head. Fruity and citrusy aroma, spicy yeasty overtones, notes of overripe yellow apple. Taste is minimally sweet wheat malty, some apple, slightly tart, citrusy counterweight, spicy yeasty overtones.
Bottle @ WWT II. Pours a clear pale golden beer, white head. Aroma is quite yeasty, some wheats. Light spicy. Flavor is spiced, medium sweet, easy drinkable. Quite a decent wit.
75cl Bottle at WWT II. Hazy pale yellow colour, white head. Aroma is spicy, clove, coriander, wheat, light citrus. Flavour is medium sweet, wheat, citrus, spices, bitter finish. Light-bodied. Nice.
Bottle shared @ WWT II. Hazy yellow color, medium sized white head. Not a lot of aroma. Taste wheat, a slight citrussy hint, a slight bitter hint surprisingly. Dry finish, ok body and carbonation.

30/03/2013 La Tana (tap). Gialla paglierino, opalescente e torbida,, schiuma a grana finissima, abbastanza abbondante e persistente. Al naso è acidula, con sentori di limone, frumento e malto, abbastanza intenso. In bocca dolciastra di malto e acidula, lievemente citrica, grande beva, nonostante faccia 7 gradi e mezzo, ne dimostra 3 di meno! Corpo medio-leggero, carbonazione media. Gran bella birra, ha la bevibilità di una blanche ma con più corpo e sostanza.
Bottle. Pours gold with white head. Nose and taste of buckwheat, banana, flaked oats and spicy malt, Full bodied. Slightly boozy banana finish.
Big bottle at restaurant Mykene, Leuven. Clear yellow colour with withe head. Some bitteress, reminds me of a duvel but a bit lighter. Fine spices in the palate. Nice beer.

Bottle 75 cl, bottled 12.5.2012. Pours cloudy pale golden in color with foamy white head. Sweet wheat, some floral and light perfume notes in aroma. Subtle hints of some spices as well. More spicy in taste, but with those sweeter notes of whet too in taste.  A bit on the sweeter side in the end with some perfume there as well.

Draft at Brick Store Pub. Hazy golden pour with a big frothy head head with some spotty lace. Grainy wheat, zesty citrus, light spicy clove and coriander, good fruitiness. Bit of creamy graininess in the flavor, zesty, crisp citrus and light spice in the flavor. Pretty nice and easy drinking beer.
Hazy yellow-orange, foamy white head, light wheat aroma, mild creamy citrus flavors, clean mouthfeel, very drinkable, mildly sour.

75 cl. bottle divided by 3 @ Bier Central. Bottled on 14/01/2012  BBF at least one year after bottling. Slightly above 1 year old now. Pours a pale golden with a big fluffy white head. Nose is very sharp, citrus, lots of sharp white pepper, hay, peel, sharp wheat & coriander / sharp. Taste is sharp upfront, sharp, iron, lightly mineral, hay, sharp wheat, sharp coriander pellets, soft wheat, very clean sharp leaning into what I think are actually pleasant side-effects of aging, not a beer I would wager to get better with age but there is some soft sweetness in the back, soft white Italian grapes, even may touch mango, dash sharp white pepper in the back. Very clean, very sharp, neat wheat backbone. One fine witbeer.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2014 75cl bottle @mosselen met friet. - Excellent amped-up Belgian Wit with plenty of character. Smooth and well-rounded thanks to the buckwheat & oats, richly seasoned with citrus, koriander and slightly more spicy, exotic notes (curaçao, anyone?). At 7%, quite heavy if consumed like a standard wit//but showing on its sleeve none of it./The mosselen met friet enjoyed it. - Once again, a confident, trendsetting brew from De Glazen Toren by an innovative take on the same old from the same soil.
Smak och doft av belgisk jäst, pommerans. Torr, söt och med en beska med apelsinskalskaraktär.

Blond nice foam with some fine co2. Nice fruity taste with grate acids thanks to the low in-mash temperature during brewing. There is no  buckwheat used in this beer.

(From notes 18.11.12) Bottle. Nice, refreshing aroma. Sharp bitter flavor. Dry. Decent beer.

Bottle @ Christers. Pours pale yellow with a white head. Aroma of malt, wheat, yeast, coriands, sweet fruit. Flavor is malt, yeast, coriands, fruity hops, light soapy. Thin body, highly overcarbonated. 231012

Very interesting with the spices. Curacao and coriander are very evident. Awesome for a white beer, and Im not always a fan of the style. It smells spicy and leaves soft, almost bubblegum like the way stuff comes together.  A little bit bitter even. Low to medium carbonation and a touch of sourness. Definitely recommend. On tap at Blue Monk.

Bottle. Slightly pale yellow with small white head. Aroma is malt, wheat, yeast, coriander and spices. Flavour is malt, yeast, high carbonation, little coriander, orange peel, hop, little with notes of alcohol.

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Hazy yellow with a big white head. Aroma is sweet, wheaty, yeasty, citrus and coriander. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish with warming alcohol. 231012

Refrigerated 75 cl brown bottle covered in paper poured into a weizen glass.  Pours cloudy orange with golden hightlights with huge fluffy white head which dissapates fairly quickly.  A little big bubble lacing, medium body, highly carbonated, and light coriander aroma.  Taste is coriander, spicy yeast, some orange, and some esters.

White foamy full lasting head. Cloudy orange-honey colour. Aroma is malty, fruity (pear, apple) , citrusy, floral with light spicy (green pepper, coriander) notes. Flavor is malty too with fruity (pear, apple, yellow plumes) and light citrus tones, ending in a light fruity, gently spicy finish. Medium bodied.
Aroma is light and sweet, but with a wheaty edge. The color is a pale yellow and appears filtered. Almost no head. Taste is at first sour with a wheat edge, but finishes with the Belgian yeast taste.

Pours very frizzy muddy light yellow. High white frizzy head
Distinct aromas of citrus, honey and sourness
Medium bodies, frizzy, sour. Nice long sour sweet palate.
Very good first evening beer!

75cl bottle. A bit cloudy but can-see-through, light yellow with bubbly white head. Nose : Yeasty and fruity. Soap with aromas of hay. Little bit of tart. Sip : pretty well carbonated, water like body with a bit creamy texture. Sweet with strong esters, soap and lemon zest aromas. Spicy clove. Overall its a refreshing one although a bit to estery for me.
Draft at DoG Street Pub.  Very light golden, still, little apparent body.  Drinks with a light and airy body, a light spicy kick, and a tart finish.  (#4737, 8/18/2012)

Draft at Churchkey. Pours a cloudy lemonade color with a decent frothy head. Nose and flavor hold really lovely fruit citrus, spicy yeast notes, hints of stone fruit, and a fantastic bit of tart dryness along with a full-bodied mouthfeel that really sets this apart from the norm in the style. Quenching, complex, and delicious.

750ml capped bottle pours a pale golden color with a 2 finger white head that settles slowly but reveals little lacing on the glass.  Aroma is light fruits with hints of yeast and spices.  Taste is fruity and light malty sweet with some yeast and a mild grassy hop bitterness.  Light bodied and abundantly carbonated leaving a prickle on the tongue. Alcohol is also noticeable.  A decent witbier, but nothing really special here.
Not much for aroma, nothing really impressive from this beer but overall not too bad. Would drink again.
Bottle. Hazy orange amber colour with a white head. Citric yeast aroma. Citric spicy flavour with a strong taste of yeast.
Pale yellow with a small white head. Flowery with fruity tones. Malt, fruit, flowers and bitterness. Medium body with a nice, dry finish.

Flaska från SB. Lätt grumlig vätska. Syrlig, frisk, lätt och ganska snällt kryddad utan att för den skull sakna karaktär. Jästig med viss pomeransbeska, aningens koriander och lite lagom tvålig i smaken. Gör sitt jobb som sommartörstsläckare väl.

Bottle, pours hazy bright yellow with medium white head. Aroma is citrus, hay and coriander. Taste is sweet with citrus, orange peel, hay, coriander, herbs. 
Nice and refreshing.

Pours a slightly hazy light yellow with a thin head that leaves some lace. Loads of citrus and spices but a little to sweet and way to much yeast taste left. For witbier lovers its still drinkable but not much more.
750ml Bottle - Golden with a white head.  Soap, lemon, yeast and spice in the aroma. Spice, lemon, soap and grapefruit all feature in the refreshing taste. Doesnt taste as strong as it is.
5th April 2010Hazy dark amber beer. A little smoky malt on the nose. Dry palate. Tea like malt, lightly smoked. A little hop bitterness in the dry finish. A bit over dry.

750ml bottle.
Pours a hazy, pale straw, big white head.
Spicy aromas, lots of oranges, tangerine, coriander seeds, wheat, yeast.
Off-dry, light to medium body, low to medium bitterness, lively CO2.
Spicy, yeasty taste, wheat, strong lemon/orange flavours, coriander. Comes through as a Hoegaarden on speed.
(2012-02-28)
Aromas of grass, lemon, some sweetness. Nice body - fruit, citrus, spice, little bit of hop. Very enjoyable.
Nice wheat beer. A little bit more hop would have made it better. Nice with chicken.
Strong spicy aroma. Sharp, slightly acidic taste. Quite refreshing. Its spicy, with a nice dry finish.
Bottle from Systembolaget. It poured a very hazy yellow liquid with a big white head. Spicy and fresh smell and taste. Nice and spicey wit.

Bottle courtesy of Larsniclas shared at tasting. Pours slightly hazy yellow with a creamy white head that slowly dissipates while leaving lots of lacing on the glass. Smell is sweet with yeasty esters, white pepper, cloves, lemon zest and wheat crackers. Taste is sweet and tiny metallic with coriander, allspice, bay leaves, grass, cloves, white pepper and wheat crackers. Mouthfeel is creamy and medium bodied. Finish is slightly sweet with cloves, crackers and lemon zest.

(Bottle) Pours yellow to pale golden with a white head. The aroma holds wheat, bread, crackers, herbal hops, perfume, soap, oranges, lemon, allspice, clove, bay leafs and touch coriander. The flavour light sweet, light bitter and light acidic with notes of citrus, spices, light alcohol, wheat, bread, minerals and light phenols. The mouthfeel is round and light tart with a light to medium carbonation. Near medium carbonation.

Nuekry golden, mediume , white head,
Fresh herby aroma and flavour with bayleves.
A bit too slcoholic.
Sampled at Larsniclas testing. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Smells fruity malty. Tastes bubbly, bitter and fruity malty.
Bottle at Gott i Lådan, Billdal, 120421. Pale yellow, big white head. Spicy wheat aroma, coriander, some hops. Hoppy flavor, yeasty, grassy, spicy, fruity notes.
Acid aroma with hints of yeast, spices, fruit and hops. Refreshing and fresh flavors of citrus, spices, yeast, wheat and fruit. Carbonation is fizzy. A really good beer!

Ottima! Aroma incredibilmente speziato con qualcosa di prosecco, grano saraceno e agrume. Al gusto, la frizzantezza eccessiva rinnova la mia impressione ad avvicinarla a un prosecco (nota che si conferma quando si scalda). Si percepiscono anche il coriandolo, Curaçao e lagrumato. E una birra che rafforza la mia affezione a questo birrificio.
Doftar citrus, muskotnöt, äpple.vinäger. Smaken är syrlig och den är ganska livligt kolsyrad och den känns lite oljig. Hur som helst så är detta en topp witbier!

(75cl bottle) Purchased at Cook Street Liquor for ~$12. Pours a huge, highly carbonated white foamy head atop a cloudy, sediment-filled yellow body. Nose is great with yeast, wheat and vanilla. Good alcohol front, crisp hoppiness. Sweet lemon and oh so smooth. Reminds me of Saxo. 

--- reviewed on RateBeer.com
bread, nuts, yellow,hazy, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, light body, oily feel, lively, bitter, long finish,
Pours opaque light golden with huge white head. Hoppy, spicy aroma. Lots of spice in the flavour, which is very nice and well balanced. Good with spicy food or by itself :)
Bottled 75cl. Murky pale golden with a huge tall white head. A lot of coriander throughout. Strong carbonation.

pours pale, hazy lemon. off white head that persists. lots of carbonation. Nose of wheat, grains, banana, fruity esters, citrus lemon. Once on the tongue, lemon, grains, bread malts. slightly tart and somewhat dry. What makes this an Imperial? Good but not overwhelming.

Väri on haalan keltainen ja hieman utuinen. Vaahto on valkoista. Tuoksussa on vehnää, appelsiinin kuoria, ja passionhedelmää. Maultaan olut on kuivan hedelmäinen, vehnäinen ja pippurinen. Suutuntumassa ei ole mitään erikoista. Hiilihappoja on aika reilusti.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Gold pour with a white head, very lively carbonation. Banana, pear, mango and stewed apple aroma. Barley sugar, yellow melon and pear flavour. A fruity little number. A little dry. Sweet, fruity finish. Nice.

Notes from a tasting in April 2011.
Aroma: citrus, orange, grain,lactobacillus
Taste:tart, citrus,orange, doughy, coriander
Overall: A big wit beer. Flavors were balanced so nothing was overwhelming.

In bottle. Pours a light golden colour with a thin white head. Aroma of black pepper, lemon, leather, candy sugar and caramel. Similar lemon flavour upfront with candy sugar again, yeast, caramel and leather. Mild carbonation and a chewy mouth-feel. Not bad with lingering caramel, white pepper and wheat. Nice and bitter.

Bottle at home ... light hazy yellow amber ... huge foam head falling to thin white lacing ... soft zezty lemon ... light yeast ... little salty nose ... very fizzy ... bitter lemon peel front ... light lime ... hint of soapyness ... little yeasty lemon ... juicy ... little tart but not sour

Hard to rate this beer alone, better to rate it in relation to Witbiers in general. In doing so, it goes from being very good to something quite exceptional. It has a very complex array of flavors including citrus tones that mix well with the light hops and bready wheat flavor.

LOVED THIS. Bottle. Pours a big full creamy head that bubbles away quickly. The color is a lovely hazy gold. Eathy cereal and citrus (orange and grapefruit) aromas. Taste was a exercise in balance that came close to perfection. Nice bready sweetness, some spice, a little citrus, a little bitter, finishing with a touch of floral perfuminess. Very crisp on the palate with lots of lively carbonation.

75 cl bottle @ home, bottled 17.04.2010, BBE 17.04.2011. 7% on the paper
Lots and lots of foam that luckily disappears quickly. Aroma is typical to strong wit: some coriander, some wheat, some orange peel, some citrus. Lots of CO2 as expected from the foaming. Flavour has orange peel, some citrus and spices. Still in very good condition even though the BBE date expired half a year ago. Refreshing and good, pretty much what I expected from a 7% wit.

750 ml bottle. Bottled 17.4.2010.
Pours a golden colour with a large, foamy, white head. Aroma of strong, sweet mandarin orange, lemon and some wheat. Flavour of sweet fruits such as mandarin orange, spices, wheat, pale malts, citrusy hops and alcohol - all in good balance. Medium bodied, soft carbonation and very smooth mouthfeel. Finish of sweet fruits, wheat, mild hops and some alcohol. Nice witbier.

75 cl bottle. BBE 20110417
Pours clear pale golden colour with large foamy head. Aroma of citrus, light malts, spices and some basement aromas. Flavour of spices, citrus, soap, apricot, earth and belgian yeast. Balanced and carbonated.
3445

Bottle thx to ekstedt cons 2011-09-24 Göteborg
AP: golden/amber, creamy organic bone white head
AR: sour, grape, white grapes, dryness
F: sour, dry, grape fruit, withe grapes, marsipan, citrus, herbs, white peppery

Courtesy of ekstedt. Pours cloudy golden amber with a great off white head leaving lace. Aroma is yeasty, fruity, spicy, cloves, citric, a bit sweet and nicely hoppy. Flavor is much like aroma with a touch of alcohol. Finishes tart fruity and bitter.

Bottle (75 cl) from Etre Gourmet. Shady deep golden, medium white head. Fruity and almondy aroma with floral notes, and some vague spices in the background. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry to semi dry, low to medium bitterness.

On tap. Pours with a hazy yellow body with a small white head. Aromas are odd. Sweet, artificial lemonade (koolaid like), bready, biscuity, spicy, floral, citrus, grapefruit juice, a hint of funk. Flavors are a bit sweet, bitter spice, bready, grainy with a backing of phenols. Lively bubbles with a medium body.
750 ml bottle a hazy yellow colored beer with a white head aroma wheat fruits herbs coriander and some hops flavor wheat herbs fruit citrus coriander and hops

Draft--had on Belgian Independence Day!  Gold color with a soft white that lasted throughout the drink with a lot of carbonation.   Citrus aroma somewhat on the pear side.   Sweet, sugary fruit flavor with a lip smacking finish. WOB

Fun story on the bottles wrapper. Good looking lemon juice yellow body, quite big on carbonation and thus a huge head. White buns, lemon, grass. Not complex but exactly as a Belgian wit should be. Refreshing light sour aroma with a gummy bear sweetness. Aftertaste is really nice to slightly dry and crisp. Interesting brew, probably the best Belgian wit Ive had. Gives me some trust back in the style! (75cl bottle)
En av de ljusare veteölen jag sett. Doftar jäst och säd. Klassisk veteölssmak som snabbt tas över av grape och citron. Den höga alkoholhalten döljs bra.
Hazy yellow body, large white head. Aroma of banana, fruist, yeast some spices. Flavour has wheat, some fruits and bread. Slightly silky and peppery. Thin.

0.75 L paper-wrapped bottle enjoyed @Den Babbelaer, Aalst. Mostly lasting, medium white head. Misty, straw colored body. Spiced and fruity aroma, sweet oranges and tangerines. Nice fruit and mild citrussy fruit flavor. Some refined sugar-sweetness and a hint of herbs/spices. Fine sparkling carbonation. Medium light in body. Fruity and spicy endnotes. Elegant and highly drinkable.

Gewürzig-hefiger Duft in dem Koriander mitspielt und von einem säuerlichen Part begleitet wird. Prickelnder, leicht saurer Antrunk. Im Mittelteil gewürzig, gleichwohl ansprechend hefesüßlich. Würzig und abgestimmt säuerlich-trocken ablaufend. Prima Witbier. Probierenswert.
Test vom 5.6.2010, Gebinde: Glasflasche

Medium white head. Hazy yellow body with carbonation. Strong herbal fruity spicy aroma with coriander notes. Dry-sweet coriander and fruit taste with soft metal notes. Fizzy mouthfeel. Light body. Delicate dry coriander and fruit aftertaste with metal and candy notes. Lovely, fresh, delicate, and drinkable. (0.75l bottle, Babelaar, Aalst.)

750 ml bottle. 7%. Bottled 17 APR 2010. From bierkompass.de.
Murky light brown colour with big fluffy off-white head.
Yeast, fruits, citrus, exotic fruits, mild crispy hops and some caramel sweetness. 
Wheat, yeast, fruits, some crispiness, mild bitterness and notes of metal. 
Full with alcohol warmth.

Bottle. Golden, cloudy, large and mostly lasting head. Moderate, sweetish malty  wheaty aroma, citrus and some spiciness. Body is medium, sweetish malty  wheaty flavor, citrus and some spiciness. Finish is average, malty  wheaty. Sweetish and lightly spiced wit  nothing special, nice head though.
Oeh le do il mio numero fortunato. Una blanche strinante, bella birra da primavera.

Capped 750 from Star Grocery in Berkeley, CA. Pours hazy dirty dishwater gold with a foamy near-white head. Theres a strong fruit aroma. Like sour light stone fruit. Not strongly sour, just a touch. 750 ml bottle (7% ABV). A hazy medium blonde beer with a large, frothy/fizzy, mostly lasting white head. The aroma is lightly to moderately malty, lightly hoppy. Medium body, lively carbonation, long finish with almost medium bitterness. Clean and perfumey, with more body and bitterness than a standars witbier. Pretty good.

Bottle. Bubbly, pale yellow clouds  with white foam. Fresh coriander, lemonpeel, and chamomile aroma. Sparkly, almost fizzy mouthfeel, blocks flavor somewhat. .25L pour - $6.00 at the Brick Store Pub in Decatur, Georgia.

Appearance: Presents a very clouded, yellow-hued body underneath an inch of creamy, lasting, whitish froth.

Smell: Pleasant, aromatic melange of soft malts, citrus accents of lemon and orange, dried herbs, light honey, and peppery fresh coriander.

Taste: Lightly bready, lightly grainy impression from the barley, wheat, oats, and buckwheat of the grain bill. Kiss of sweet-tasting honey candy. Traces of subtle lemon juice preceding the bolder curaçoa. Big boost of spicy coriander and dried bitter orange peelings. Minor acidity. Hint of herbal hops, though very, very little bitterness, leaving the added spices to do the job of countering the sweetness. Finishes dry, continually spicy, and quite crisp.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Medium-high carbonation. 

Drinkability: Definitely bigger than your garden variety witbier, but, with luck, the imperialization of the brew didnt turn this one ganky and unpleasant to drink. On the contrary, it was satiating and went down rather easily.

Shared bottle. Surprised that this was described as a white beer, more of a sour I would have thought. Aroma is red wine plus sour apple. Very lively on opening, plummy aftertaste, with a great full flavoured and satisfying finish.

a very crisp, belgian wheat ale, not so much the double version because of the abv, but because of the very tight almost champagne-like bubbles that dissipate very quickly. an enjoyable blend of the spices and oats, the only distasteful part is that the brewers yeast is brown and when poured into the glass, looks like you just poured brown sugar into your beer. After this "white" journey I have been on for the last year or so, and trying many different versions the one thing that is absolutely clear to me is that there are two distinct types of belgian wheat ales, the true witbier, and the belgian wheat ale, one having the traditional spice and coriandor, possibly a little orange in the flavor, made popular in the US by Allagash white. The other, which seems to be the more common wheat ale style, usually found flitered, a more crisp palate and without the "fat" taste of a witbier, this styles best example made by St. Bernardus.

Yellow in color. Thin white head. Had on tap at Lucky Baldwins. Light citrus taste with lemon. Hazy looking. An excellent beer.

Draft at The Porter. The pour is horrendous - a cloudy, opaque brown with no head. The aroma, on the other hand, is pleasant - cleansing with strong notes of lemon peel, coriander, and wheat. There is a lot of coriander spice and lot of bitter citrus - like lemon rind and grapefruit. The flavor of wheat is perceptible, too. At mid-palate, a funky earthiness - like leather - enters along with more citrus and a very firm bitterness. The finish is bitter with citrus and coriander and is cleansing. The aftertaste reminds me of other spices, though - lavender and chamomile. The mouthfeel is stinging with lively carbonation and is medium-full in body. Overall, a very funky, refreshing, and strongly interesting beer (but would be hard to drink in large volume).

29-Apr-07 (750 ml corked and caged bottle, Bottled on 11-Mar-06: $11.79 at Holiday Wine Cellar in Escondido, CA)  The beer pours like sparkling wine, a voluminous, fluffy, white head that quickly recedes to a thin layer, leaving only a few small spots of foam on the glass.  Golden in color, the body is hazy, but not cloudy, with the densely packed sediment remaining in the bottle.  Citrusy, grassy and slightly sweet, the nose is initially reminiscent of Sauvignon Blanc, but aromas of funk and yeast soon join in, dispelling the perception of white wine.  And as the beer warms, a slightly bready graininess develops, adding complexity.  Because of the higher ABV, its not unreasonable to think this Dubbel Wit might be sweeter than the stylistically correct, lower ABV examples (probably because the amped-up witbiers produced in the USA often are sweeter), but this is definitely not the case here.  Yes, there is more of a suggestion of sweetness here, but its far, far in the background, easily superceded by the prominent citrusy tartness.  I wont call this a sour beer, per se, but the beer is certainly trending in that general direction.  Curaçao gives the beer an orange citrus, even a lemony quality that emphasizes tartness and gentle bitterness rather than sweet orange flavor.  Based on the perceived flavors, the added candi sugar hasnt been carmelized and has fully fermented, so its only apparent contribution is a boost to the ABV.  Coriander is perfectly integrated and isnt a prominent flavor.  Very dusty and cobwebby quality works well with the yeasty notes and significantly adds to the generally dry mouthfeel.  On the palate, this highly carbonated and wonderfully refreshing beer is medium in body, but seems much lighter due to the considerable tartness and carbonation.  Its quite expansive in the mouth and fairly bloating in the stomach as well, so boisterous eructations are unavoidable.  Overall, this is one of the most tart Belgian Whites Ive run across, and this along with the elevated ABV places this beer beyond the styles range, but the end result is fabulous.  The combination of lemon, orange, funk, yeast and dust make for a truly memorable drinking experience.  Highly recommended, despite the wallet-thinning price tag.

Overall the aroma is dry, a bit tart, and definitely spicy.

The taste is lightly tart with a spritzy lemon character.  The finish has a certain tannic note to it that is lightly mouth puckering, perhaps there is a bit of chalkiness here as well.  Quite dry, and quite light on the palate, this could almost pass for a normal Wit.  Except for the bit of a bite of alcohol in the finish, and a soft creaminess that the body starts to pick up as the beer warms up.  The dominant flavor in this beer is of lemon peel, though it is only lightly tart.  Spicy notes of ginger, earthy and even lightly vegetal coriander notes, and a definite herbal note that seems to be a mix of mint, chamomile, perhaps some basil and even a note of licorice as the beer warms up.  This is definitely a tasty beer, it remains quite drinkable just like a normal Wit, but with an extra kick of alcohol.  It could be a bit richer though, more towards the double side of things, but it is actually quite in line with other Double Wits that I have had.

hazy yellow beer with a small white head. coriander, coriander and coriander in the nose, some citrus and wheat can be detected too. taste is sourrish, lemony, sweetish and bitterish and oh yes...spicy! nicely balanced but far too much coriander.

Hazy fresh yellow collor with very nice white head. Lime zest in the aroma with touch of corriander, curaçao orange peel and the lightnees of wheat. The taste is round and has this lemony soury accent. It has a good mouthfeel with a clean refreshing aftertaste and a touch of ricecrackers.

White head, gone in secs; fully hazy yellow beer. Coriander (with the sackfull), perfumed, bit citrussy, and indeed, wheaty nose. Perfumed and fruity taste, coriander very obvious, but not all-conquering - though it isnt far off. Its balanced sour-sweet which is a good point. Medium bodied, very refreshing. The balance saves it. Still, next time, guys: 1/2 the amount of coriander, PLEASE. No, make that 1/3 for safetys sake...
